At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Join the Atlas Search Query team to design and develop the next generation of Search query architecture, optimization and execution.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Atlas Search is a growing cloud service that allows users to execute complex search queries using the MongoDB Query Language. Our users are free to focus on relevance and data retrieval instead of the machinery needed to search data at scale.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Our team is building a cloud-based distributed system responsible for the core components of search including: data ingestion, performance, query language, query execution, and aggregation. Our product is being adopted quickly and there are many interesting projects.\u0026amp;nbsp; This is a visible leadership role where you will be responsible for the technical success of our Search Query interface.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role is based in our San Francisco office.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h2\u0026gt;Ideally you will be:\u0026lt;/h2\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;8+ years experience in data management systems, specifically with a strong background in query processing and optimization. A Master\u0026#39;s or Ph.D degree in a related field is strongly preferred\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Professionally experienced with designing high volume query engines, such as a database or search system\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Eager to shape the technological direction of a complex system and have the ability to lead this initiative through collaboration with others\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experienced in development and maintenance of stateful distributed systems, or search platforms\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Proficient in modern programming languages and techniques\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h2\u0026gt;You would get to:\u0026lt;/h2\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Build and design our integrated search platform, written in Java\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Lead complex projects spanning search services and MongoDB ecosystem\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Identify, design, implement, test, and support new features related to query performance and robustness, query language enhancements and diagnostics for query performance problems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Perform code reviews with peers and make recommendations on how to improve our code and software development processes\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Set initiative level strategy, architect plan and lead team towards successful execution\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Collaborate with other teams including database, cloud services, enterprise tools, drivers and support\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Influence and grow team members through active mentoring, coaching and leading by example\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h2\u0026gt;Success Measures:\u0026lt;/h2\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 1 month, you will be mostly learning -\u0026amp;nbsp; At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Account Managers are at the forefront of technical problem solving with key customers, working on some of the most complex and exciting application ecosystems built on the MongoDB platform. TAMs combine:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Deep product knowledge and expertise across multiple domains\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Polished technical communications\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong account leadership, with the ability to engage effectively at all levels of the customer\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to not only proactively engage, but anticipate and preempt needs a customer may have or issues they could experience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;A high degree of ownership and willingness to go above and beyond for our customers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The TAM’s primary remit is the cultivation of customer confidence and delivery of positive, account-wide technical outcomes that solve big customer problems while showcasing the capabilities of the MongoDB product portfolio. They do this through a systematic engagement process including deep discovery and the development of a roadmap of shared objectives. They are able to operate in complex environments where there may be shared or even ambiguous responsibilities between the customer and MongoDB. The TAM is able to shift gears between enabling, coaching and mentoring, and marshaling resources to get the right things done at the right time.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The TAM also acts as the eyes and ears of the product team while working with marquee customers as they will sometimes surface new requirements or potential areas of opportunity for future development. They work closely with these teams to understand these requirements, manage expectations, and ensure MongoDB is staying one step ahead of customer needs.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role will be an early hire into the new Technical Account Management function and will help pioneer the new service offering for MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Successful candidates will have the flexibility to work around the schedules of customers with 100% uptime systems while enjoying the life/work balance MongoDB promotes.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Milan for our hybrid working model where you’ll be expected to go 3 days a week into the office.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, focused on innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally skilled people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make a positive impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to unlock the inner genius of our customers by making data stunningly easy to work with. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help our customers succeed with MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As a Technical Account Manager, you’ll be highly engaged with a handful of our largest customers, building key relationships with technical leaders and collaborating with them on their projects to build and scale MongoDB solutions - resolving questions and demonstrating solutions related to architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on the best way to run MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You will identify deep dive opportunities to educate our customers on crucial topics of concern to them and either conduct those deep dives yourself or make timely connections between customers and subject matter experts within MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will also mentor and ramp new team members, and take initiatives in building knowledge of new product lines within the MongoDB ecosystem.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should have 7+ years of relevant experience. We consider all candidates, with an eye for those who combine formal education with self-teaching, are insatiably curious, and are multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;It’s crucial for every candidate to check these boxes\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Communicator\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fosterer of open lines of communication amongst internal stakeholders; The TAM ensures all concerned parties, including in some cases the MongoDB executive team, are well informed about accounts within the TAM’s portfolio (especially during critical or escalated situations)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;For external stakeholders: great communication and account leadership skills, with a good organizational understanding of customers and ability to calibrate communication style based on the audience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Collaborator\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Scale experience: The TAM must quickly understand and communicate about customer workloads, use cases, and resiliency criteria, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Product evangelism: The TAM helps customers understand how the MongoDB developer data platform is well-suited to solve a wide variety of their problems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to work independently as well as cross-functionally to ensure customer needs are being met\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Genuine desire to help people, and to increase their confidence and good will\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to cultivate strong team partnerships: Understanding of when and how to seek help from team members, skill in choosing from potentially conflicting perspectives or approaches; ability to secure commitments and lead collaborative efforts\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Problem procedures for optimizing MongoDB’s technical relationship with marquee customers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience managing large scale databases (e.g. RDBMS, NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Extensive experience with mass scale application architectures\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Microservices/Serverless architectures\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;CI/CD tools and approaches\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Containerization, orchestration and management tools\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enterprise Identity platforms\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong systems engineering and troubleshooting experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, virtualization, clustering\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Success At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Account Managers are at the forefront of technical problem solving with key customers, working on some of the most complex and exciting application ecosystems built on the MongoDB platform. TAMs combine:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Deep product knowledge and expertise across multiple domains\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Polished technical communications\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong account leadership, with the ability to engage effectively at all levels of the customer\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to not only proactively engage, but anticipate and preempt needs a customer may have or issues they could experience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;A high degree of ownership and willingness to go above and beyond for our customers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The TAM’s primary remit is the cultivation of customer confidence and delivery of positive, account-wide technical outcomes that solve big customer problems while showcasing the capabilities of the MongoDB product portfolio. They do this through a systematic engagement process including deep discovery and the development of a roadmap of shared objectives. They are able to operate in complex environments where there may be shared or even ambiguous responsibilities between the customer and MongoDB. The TAM is able to shift gears between enabling, coaching and mentoring, and marshaling resources to get the right things done at the right time.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The TAM also acts as the eyes and ears of the product team while working with marquee customers as they will sometimes surface new requirements or potential areas of opportunity for future development. They work closely with these teams to understand these requirements, manage expectations, and ensure MongoDB is staying one step ahead of customer needs.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role will be an early hire into the new Technical Account Management function and will help pioneer the new service offering for MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Successful candidates will have the flexibility to work around the schedules of customers with 100% uptime systems while enjoying the life/work balance MongoDB promotes.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Dublin for our hybrid working model where you’ll be expected to go 3 days a week into the office.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, focused on innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally skilled people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make a positive impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to unlock the inner genius of our customers by making data stunningly easy to work with. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help our customers succeed with MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As a Technical Account Manager, you’ll be highly engaged with a handful of our largest customers, building key relationships with technical leaders and collaborating with them on their projects to build and scale MongoDB solutions - resolving questions and demonstrating solutions related to architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on the best way to run MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You will identify deep dive opportunities to educate our customers on crucial topics of concern to them and either conduct those deep dives yourself or make timely connections between customers and subject matter experts within MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will also mentor and ramp new team members, and take initiatives in building knowledge of new product lines within the MongoDB ecosystem.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should have 7+ years of relevant experience. We consider all candidates, with an eye for those who combine formal education with self-teaching, are insatiably curious, and are multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;It’s crucial for every candidate to check these boxes\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Communicator\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fosterer of open lines of communication amongst internal stakeholders; The TAM ensures all concerned parties, including in some cases the MongoDB executive team, are well informed about accounts within the TAM’s portfolio (especially during critical or escalated situations)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;For external stakeholders: great communication and account leadership skills, with a good organizational understanding of customers and ability to calibrate communication style based on the audience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Collaborator\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Scale experience: The TAM must quickly understand and communicate about customer workloads, use cases, and resiliency criteria, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Product evangelism: The TAM helps customers understand how the MongoDB developer data platform is well-suited to solve a wide variety of their problems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to work independently as well as cross-functionally to ensure customer needs are being met\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Genuine desire to help people, and to increase their confidence and good will\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to cultivate strong team partnerships: Understanding of when and how to seek help from team members, skill in choosing from potentially conflicting perspectives or approaches; ability to secure commitments and lead collaborative efforts\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Problem Solver\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Comfort thinking on your feet, solving problems in real-time, and reducing pressure and anxiety through calm, authoritative technical leadership; ability to keep your cool and project command presence during escalated situations where tensions and anxiety may be high\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to design, communicate, and follow a structured approach to solving complex problems based loosely upon the scientific method\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience analyzing and pursuing issues holistically in the enterprise; spanning multiple technologies, customer teams and silos\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Technical Expert\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience building, maintaining, tuning, and troubleshooting sophisticated mission-critical production database systems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Familiarity with modern service architectures\u0026amp;nbsp; and the implications on development teams, their structures and the development lifecycle\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with the technologies and development patterns typical of a large-scale enterprise customer\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using any cloud services stack such as AWS, Azure or GCP\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Builder\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Develop, document, and help implement techniques, tools and procedures for optimizing MongoDB’s technical relationship with marquee customers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience managing large scale databases (e.g. RDBMS, NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Extensive experience with mass scale application architectures\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Microservices/Serverless architectures\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;CI/CD tools and systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong systems engineering and troubleshooting experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We\u0026#39;re looking for trainers, instructors or engineers interested in helping us provide best-in-class technology education. Our ideal candidate is a software developer with experience of teaching. You\u0026#39;ve built some non-trivial applications. You also have a passion for communicating complex concepts and coaching others to help them build powerful new skills.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This unique role combines teaching and software engineering. Our instructors have the opportunity to become true MongoDB experts and continue honing developer skills, and deliver highly interactive\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/services/training\u0026quot;\u0026gt;instructor-led training courses\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt; to help people get the most out of MongoDB technologies. When applying, please let us know in a few words why you\u0026#39;d be a good fit. Talented full-stack developer? Technology geek? Hacker who loves to speak to and mentor others? If any of these descriptions fit, then we\u0026#39;d love to hear from you!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We\u0026#39;re looking to speak with candidates across the United States for this remote opportunity.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Deliver a variety of multi-day technical courses on MongoDB via a combination of presentation and demonstration, facilitated discussion, coaching and advising, and student lab troubleshooting and support\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Classes can be both public/open enrollment and private/client-specific and can be taught both remotely online and in-person\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Continuously invest in your own learning and development, to build elite MongoDB expertise through a combination of attending training, shadowing experts, receiving mentoring, performing coding projects, and self-study\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Contribute regularly to our curriculum, drawing upon your programming, database administration, communication, and MongoDB product expertise to improve existing courses and author new highly technical learning content, laboratory environments, exercises, and instructor guides\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Maintain product and industry knowledge, learning new product features and teaching methods, collaborating with MongoDB product engineering, field, and curriculum teams to maintain subject matter expertise and contribute to curriculum\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Support our content development team in bringing new courses and major course updates to market through materials review, beta teaches, “train-the-trainer” programs, and supporting MongoDB’s instructors around the world in delivering the new courses effectively\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Perform instructor certification processes on fellow instructors to ensure instructors new to teaching a particular subject are able to deliver up to our high standards\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Develop sample applications for inclusion in our courses using a variety of programming languages\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Prepare tailored training content to customer needs for private classes and/or deliver the tailored training to the customer\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Travel up to 50% of the time when the customer requests instructor presence at their location\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Experience you’ll need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related engineering discipline, or equivalent experience in a software or technology-related field\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Aptitude and attitude are more important than credentials\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Demonstrated experience in any of the following areas: teaching/facilitating training events for a highly technical audience, technical training content development, technical mentoring\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Solid understanding of a programming language\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Knowledge of at least one other programming language is a big plus (e.g., Javascript, Java, Python)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;You are comfortable and familiar with modern software development practices and infrastructure\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using one or more database technologies. Knowledge of MongoDB is a plus\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong verbal and written communication skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;A “can-do” attitude, and the willingness to work collaboratively with all members of the extended Training department team\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;You enjoy self-driven exploration and education on new technologies and languages, and can adapt innovative technologies and learn quickly in a fast-paced environment\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Whilst not mandatory, Certified Instructor status with any major software vendor or a recognized technical training qualification (such as CompTIA CTT+), or similar relevant experience will be a plus.\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Success Measures\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Within 3 months:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Complete new hire technical training to acquire hands-on technical knowledge of MongoDB products, their specific capabilities, and use cases\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Via new hire training, shadowing, and self study, acquire a deep knowledge of MongoDB instructor-led training offerings, student personae, and learning objectives\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Complete qualification process to teach one multi-day course independently\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Within 6 months:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Successfully deliver multiple MongoDB courses\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Begin to deliver customer-specific and tailored training engagements\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Build deep MongoDB knowledge related to the courses you teach\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Contribute to the curriculum by proactively suggesting corrections, improvements, or innovations. As requested, perform additional curriculum-related work\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Contribute to student experience by developing additional sample applications and student hands-on exercises\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Within 12 months:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Take leadership in one or more areas such as:\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Qualifying and mentoring other instructors\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Teaching difficult advanced combinations of content\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Contributing significantly to curriculum and lab exercises\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Developing specialized or advanced MongoDB product expertise\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role can be based remotely in North America.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys.\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/channel/culture\u0026quot;\u0026gt; Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it much easier to manage and scale database deployments.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Our Cloud Technical Services Engineers provide their exceptional analytical skills and customer service to ensure that MongoDB users are successful with our suite of MongoDB application-layer products. We’re looking for individuals who want to dig into the details of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated every day by organisations of every size and flavour.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Cloud Technical Services Engineers are a key part of our elite Technical Services organisation that supports MongoDB customers worldwide, with teams in locations including New York, Sydney, Gurugram, and Dublin. If you’re passionate about the opportunity to get comfortable working with the cloud every single day and be part of a team that works at the frontier of SaaS services and database systems, this is the role for you.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Sydney/Melbourne for our hybrid working model.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, focused on innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Responsibilities\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As a Cloud Technical Services Engineer, you’ll be advising customers on strategies and documented practices for making best use of our cloud products. This will require you to translate technical concepts and patterns into generalist’s terms for our customers, helping them understand, install, and use those applications well. You’ll also troubleshoot technical problems with these products, and be an advocate for our users’ needs, collaborating with the MongoDB product management and development teams on their behalf.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services puts a strong focus on engineers enabling their peers to be successful by sharing newly gained technical knowledge with the team, either via informal one-to-one conversations, or training and workshop sessions. By documenting solutions in our knowledge base system, Cloud TSEs will increase the efficiency of our customers, other team members and departments throughout MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You must be willing and able to work weekends. This is a full-time position working Tuesday to Saturday, based in-office at our Melbourne or Sydney location.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What we’re looking for\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self taught, curious, and multi-faceted. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role will be based in our Dublin office 3-5 days per week, and will be a Monday - Friday work week.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;About the team\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The Technical Services team focuses on helping customers to be successful with MongoDB products. Learning and supporting these products will provide you a great deal of exposure to modern technologies such as Cloud, Kubernetes, configuration management tools and managing instances in the public cloud (AWS, GCP and Azure).\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud, and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (our Cloud platform) and products that run on top of Atlas like Search, Data Lake and Realm serverless functions, triggers and mobile sync. Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to help our customers be successful with MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex challenges - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - interfacing with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;In this specific role, starting from the MongoDB database, you will also focus on the performance of our Cloud platform Atlas and its supported services. You will help both frontend and backend developers build next generation applications on MongoDB platform.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates who are insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The ideal candidates will have strong technical experience in one (or more) of the following areas. We are open to training people up in certain areas, so don\u0026#39;t worry about ticking every box!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB or other database solutions (RDBMS or NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Should have a good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, etc.)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with cloud-based infrastructure solutions such as AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or Google Compute Engine\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with Kubernetes or other orchestration systems using vendor-specific Enterprise operators\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As this role is technical but also about helping our customers, we are looking for:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Genuine desire to help people\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Uncontrollable urge to investigate and solve problems, with advanced diagnostic and troubleshooting skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure, and solve problems in real-time\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong teamwork: willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and the good judgment to know when to seek help\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with authentication systems such as LDAP, Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;End-user experience using system monitoring, backup, and operations management technologies (including but not limited to Cloud Manager, New Relic, Glacier, HP Operations Manager, IBM Tivoli, Nagios, or Oracle Cloud)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience coding or scripting in one or more of JavaScript, Python, Bash, Ruby, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, Go, Node.js, Perl\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;General knowledge or experience with automation technologies such as Chef or Puppet\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Multilingual\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Success Measures\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 3 months, you’ll have gained a deep understanding of MongoDB and its ecosystem. You will complete New Hire Training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 6 months, you will be comfortable working directly with our customers. You will also complete the MongoDB Certified DBA Associate exam\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 12 months, you will work on gaining expertise to be a part of a technical experts group within the MongoDB ecosystem and will be helping your peer engineers in advance diagnostics Also, you will be encouraged to handle technical escalations independently\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Benefits include\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Competitive salary, pension contribution and equity\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Free lunches 3 days a week in the office, with unlimited free snacks, refreshments and drinks\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;VHI Health cover, dental cover, travel insurance and life assurance\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Bike to work scheme, commuter tax saver scheme, secure bike storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Regular performance, compensation and development reviews\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;27 annual leave days + 10 public holidays\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;20 weeks Maternity \u0026amp;amp; Paternity leave to spend time with new arrivals\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Wellness programme, fertility benefit and meditation benefits\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To find out more about what it’s like to be a Technical Services Engineer at MongoDB, check out this\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/technical-services-engineering-at-mongo-db-meet-alex-bevilacqua\u0026quot;\u0026gt; link\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys.\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/channel/culture\u0026quot;\u0026gt; Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (database as a service), or Cloud Manager (which helps customers with automation, backup and monitoring of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork and a great sense of humour to help our customers to be successful with MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in\u0026amp;nbsp;Milan.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex challenges - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - interfacing with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Click here to learn more about our \u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://app.guide.co/p/a85fd0b5-69c8-409c-a955-334ec70defd3\u0026quot;\u0026gt;Technical Services team.\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;About the team\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their outstanding problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are specialists in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, our management suite, as well as services such as\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://cloud.mongodb.com/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;Atlas\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, Cloud Manager, Compass to name a few. Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to achieve exceptional results for our customers. We’re looking for individuals who want to dig into the details of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated every day by organizations of every size and flavor.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in São Paulo for our hybrid working model.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You’ll be providing an unparalleled customer experience by advising customers on strategies and documented practices for making best use of our products.\u0026amp;nbsp; You\u0026#39;ll be an authority on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What You Need/What we are looking for\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;While our ideal candidate will have a 3-5 years of proven technical experience, we consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-driven, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026amp;nbsp; It’s crucial that every candidate possess the following skills to effectively perform the type of investigative and diagnostic work expected of Technical Services Engineers:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Overwhelming desire to investigate and solve problems, with advanced diagnostic and troubleshooting skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience analyzing issues holistically, from the application tier through the database, down to the storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure, and solve problems in real-time\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Comfortable working on the command line, in the GUI, and everywhere in between.\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Patience, empathy and genuine desire to help people\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Collaboration: willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and the good judgment to know when to seek help\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Your professional or self-taught experiences should have provided you with a strong understanding and grasp of three or more of the following areas:\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Application Architecture\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems Administration - OS, Networking, Diagnostics\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Network Administration\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Development, automation, or hardware\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Data Modeling\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Performance Analysis and optimization\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Automation and Orchestration workflows (aka DevOps backgrounds)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Prior knowledge of either AWS or another Cloud Provider platform\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fundamental understanding of relational OR non-relational database systems, including administration and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;If you have an operations background, we prefer experience administering large-scale production environments, including hardware, operating systems (e.g. Linux, Windows), Networks (including firewalls and load balancers), as well as cloud-based resources (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP).\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB or other database solutions (RDBMS or NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with authentication systems such as LDAP, Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using any cloud services stack such as AWS, Azure or GCP\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with Kubernetes or other skills, a MongoDB or Cloud Certification, or previous support experience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;General knowledge or experience with automation technologies such as Chef or Puppet\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, You will complete New Hire Training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 6 months, you will be comfortable working frontline with our customers. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role will be based in our Dublin office 3-5 days per week, and will be a Monday - Friday work week.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;About the team\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The Technical Services team focuses on helping customers to be successful with MongoDB products. Learning and supporting these products will provide you a great deal of exposure to modern technologies such as Cloud, Kubernetes, configuration management tools and managing instances in the public cloud (AWS, GCP and Azure).\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud, and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (our Cloud platform) and products that run on top of Atlas like Search, Data Lake and Realm serverless functions, triggers and mobile sync. Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to help our customers be successful with MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex challenges - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - interfacing with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;In this specific role, starting from the MongoDB database, you will also focus on the performance of our Cloud platform Atlas and its supported services. You will help both frontend and backend developers build next generation applications on MongoDB platform.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates who are insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The ideal candidates will have strong technical experience in one (or more) of the following areas. or other database solutions (RDBMS or NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Should have a good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, cloud-based infrastructure solutions such as AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or Google Compute Engine\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with Kubernetes or other orchestration systems using vendor-specific Enterprise operators\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As this role is technical but also about helping our customers, we are looking people\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Uncontrollable urge to investigate Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;End-user experience using system monitoring, backup, and operations management technologies (including but not limited to Cloud Manager, New PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, Go, Node.js, Perl\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;General knowledge or experience with automation technologies such as Chef or At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it easier and faster to scale database deployments. These next-generation applications currently include Cloud SaaS offerings, database visualization tools, BI connectors, and on-prem database management. We’re passionate about building better tools for a better database.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Application and Integration (A\u0026amp;amp;I) Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem-solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in putting the pieces together - whether that’s starting from scratch or inserting MongoDB into existing infrastructure. And work to ensure that MongoDB users are successful with our suite of MongoDB application-layer products. We’re looking for engineers who get the big picture of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will be a key part of our elite Technical Services organization that supports MongoDB customers worldwide, with teams in locations like New York, Austin, Palo Alto, Sydney, Dublin and Tel Aviv.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Gurugram for our In-office model (3 days in office).\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an authority on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - collaborating with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-taught, curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will have strong experience in at least two of the following areas: application architecture, systems administration, network administration, development, solution architecture, automation, or hardware, performance tuning, and benchmarking. If you have an operations background, we prefer experience administering large-scale production environments, including hardware, operating systems (e.g. Linux, Windows), networks (including firewalls and load balancers), as well as cloud-based resources (e.g. AWS, Azure, OpenStack).\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;It’s crucial for every candidate that they can check off all of these boxes\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Comfortable working at the command line\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Excellent communication skills, both written and and troubleshooting skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to think on your feet and remain calm under pressure\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong teamwork- willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and the good judgment to know when to seek help\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;End-user experience using system monitoring, backup, and operations management technologies (including but not limited to Cloud Manager, New Relic, Glacier, HP Operations Manager, IBM Tivoli, Nagios, or Oracle Cloud)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with cloud-based infrastructure solutions such as AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or Google Compute Engine\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Technical writing and/or training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Previous work experience with JIRA and SalesForce Service Cloud\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB or other You will also complete the MongoDB Certified DBA Associate exam\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 12 months, you will work on gaining expertise to be a part of a technical experts group within MongoDB and will be helping your peer engineers in advance diagnostics. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it easier and faster to scale database deployments. These next-generation applications currently include Cloud SaaS offerings, database visualization tools, BI connectors, and on-prem database management. We’re passionate about building better tools for a better database.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Application and Integration (A\u0026amp;amp;I) Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem-solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in putting the pieces together - whether that’s starting from scratch or inserting MongoDB into existing infrastructure. And work to ensure that MongoDB users are successful with our suite of MongoDB application-layer products. We’re looking for engineers who get the big picture of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will be a key part of our elite Technical Services organization that supports MongoDB customers worldwide, with teams in locations like New York, Austin, Palo Alto, Sydney, Dublin and Tel Aviv.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Gurugram for our In-office model (3 days in office).\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an authority on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - collaborating with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-taught, curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You will have strong experience in at least two of the following areas: application architecture, systems administration, network administration, development, solution architecture, automation, or hardware, performance tuning, and benchmarking. If you have an operations background, we prefer experience administering large-scale production environments, including hardware, operating systems (e.g. Linux, Windows), networks (including firewalls and load balancers), as well as cloud-based resources (e.g. AWS, Azure, OpenStack).\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;It’s crucial for every candidate that they can check off all of these boxes\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Comfortable working at the command line\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Genuine desire to help people\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Uncontrollable urge to investigate and solve problems, with advanced diagnostic and troubleshooting skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to think on your feet and remain calm under pressure\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong teamwork- willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and the good judgment to know when to seek help\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;End-user experience using system monitoring, backup, and operations management technologies (including but not limited to Cloud Manager, New Relic, Glacier, HP Operations Manager, IBM Tivoli, Nagios, or Oracle Cloud)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with cloud-based infrastructure solutions such as AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or Google Compute Engine\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Technical writing and/or training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Previous work experience with JIRA and SalesForce Service Cloud\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB or other database solutions (RDBMS or NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;General knowledge or experience with automation technologies such as Chef or Puppet\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Understanding of data storage technologies\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience coding or scripting in one or more of JavaScript, These next-generation systems are a growing list but currently include products such as Atlas (\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;http://www.cloud.mongodb.com/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;www.cloud.mongodb.com\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;), Cloud Manager and Compass.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their outstanding problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are specialists in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, our management suite, and services such as Cloud Manager (the online product we developed for customers for automation, backup, monitoring, and analysis of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to achieve exceptional results for our customers.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are currently operating a hybrid working model and at this time, are ideally looking to speak with candidates who are available in Sydney or Melbourne.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on standard methodologies in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services puts a strong focus on engineers enabling their peers to be successful by sharing newly gained technical knowledge with the team, either via informal one-to-one conversations, or training and workshop sessions. By documenting solutions in our knowledge platform, TSEs will increase the efficiency of our customers, other team members and departments throughout MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should have 4+ years of proven experience, we consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-taught, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;The ideal candidate should have a mix of experience in most of the following areas:\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong diagnostics and troubleshooting experience, with the ability to analyze issues holistically, from the application tier, to database to storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to read code, and basic coding/scripting ability in one or more languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, etc\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, etc.)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, RAID, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience supporting complex mission-critical product applications and database systems (RDMBS or non-relational)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should possess a genuine desire to help people, the ability to think on your feet and remain calm under pressure while solving problems in real-time. There’s a lot to learn, so the desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills is paramount. We work in a collaborative team environment, so a willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and good judgment to know when to seek help, is essential. We also aim to have diverse technical backgrounds and therefore different subject matter expertise is welcome.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;\u0026lt;em\u0026gt;You do not need to have prior experience with MongoDB.
