We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it much easier to manage and scale database deployments. These next-generation systems are a growing list but currently include products such as Atlas (\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;http://www.cloud.mongodb.com/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;www.cloud.mongodb.com\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;), Cloud Manager and Compass.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their outstanding problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are specialists in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, our management suite, and services such as Cloud Manager (the online product we developed for customers for automation, backup, monitoring, and analysis of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to achieve exceptional results for our customers.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are currently operating a hybrid working model and at this time, are ideally looking to speak with candidates who are available in Sydney or Melbourne.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on standard methodologies in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services puts a strong focus on engineers enabling their peers to be successful by sharing newly gained technical knowledge with the team, either via informal one-to-one conversations, or training and workshop sessions. By documenting solutions in our knowledge platform, TSEs will increase the efficiency of our customers, other team members and departments throughout MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should have 4+ years of proven experience, we consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-taught, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;The ideal candidate should have a mix of experience in most of the following areas:\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong diagnostics and troubleshooting experience, with the ability to analyze issues holistically, from the application tier, to database to storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to read code, and basic coding/scripting ability in one or more languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, etc\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, etc.)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, RAID, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience supporting complex mission-critical product applications and database systems (RDMBS or non-relational)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should possess a genuine desire to help people, the ability to think on your feet and remain calm under pressure while solving problems in real-time. There’s a lot to learn, so the desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills is paramount. We work in a collaborative team environment, so a willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and good judgment to know when to seek help, is essential. We also aim to have diverse technical backgrounds and therefore different subject matter expertise is welcome.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;\u0026lt;em\u0026gt;You do not need to have prior experience with MongoDB. We can teach you that!\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/em\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with authentication systems such as LDAP, Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using any cloud services stack such as AWS, Azure or GCP\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with Kubernetes or other orchestration systems using vendor-specific Enterprise operators\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Success Measures\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 3 months, you’ll have gained a deep understanding of MongoDB and its ecosystem. You will complete New Hire Training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 6 months, you will be comfortable working frontline with our customers. You will also complete the MongoDB Certified DBA Associate exam\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 12 months, you will be a part of a technical experts group within MongoDB and will be helping your peer engineers in advance diagnostics. Also, you will be encouraged to handle technical escalations independently\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys.\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/channel/culture\u0026quot;\u0026gt; Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;","departments":[{"id":38814,"name":"Support","child_ids":[],"parent_id":6186}],"offices":[{"id":14625,"name":"Melbourne","location":"Melbourne, Victoria, Australia","child_ids":[],"parent_id":23659},{"id":3965,"name":"Sydney","location":"Sydney, New South Wales, Australia","child_ids":[],"parent_id":23659}]},{"absolute_url":"https://www.mongodb.com/careers/job/?gh_jid=5381023","data_compliance":[{"type":"gdpr","requires_consent":false,"requires_processing_consent":false,"requires_retention_consent":false,"retention_period":null}],"internal_job_id":2682879,"location":{"name":"Sydney, Melbourne"},"metadata":[{"id":22194060,"name":"Position ID","value":null,"value_type":"short_text"},{"id":24918,"name":"Department ID","value":"D11100-Support","value_type":"single_select"},{"id":22194061,"name":"Team","value":null,"value_type":"single_select"},{"id":4914027,"name":"Region","value":"APAC","value_type":"single_select"},{"id":4137836,"name":"Working Model Eligibility","value":["1-In Office"],"value_type":"multi_select"},{"id":4914029,"name":"Job Level","value":"IC - At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it much easier to manage and scale database deployments.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Our Cloud Technical Services Engineers provide their exceptional analytical skills and customer service to ensure that MongoDB users are successful with our suite of MongoDB application-layer products. We’re looking for individuals who want to dig into the details of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated every day by organisations of every size and flavour.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Cloud Technical Services Engineers are a key part of our elite Technical Services organisation that supports MongoDB customers worldwide, with teams in locations including New York, Sydney, Gurugram, and Dublin. If you’re passionate about the opportunity to get comfortable working with the cloud every single day and be part of a team that works at the frontier of SaaS services and database systems, this is the role for you.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Sydney/Melbourne for our hybrid working model.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, focused on innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Responsibilities\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As a Cloud Technical Services Engineer, you’ll be advising customers on strategies and documented practices for making best use of our cloud products. This will require you to translate technical concepts and patterns into generalist’s terms for our customers, helping them understand, install, and use those applications well. You’ll also troubleshoot technical problems with these products, and be an advocate for our users’ needs, collaborating with the MongoDB product management and development teams on their behalf.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services puts a strong focus on engineers enabling their peers to be successful by sharing newly gained technical knowledge with the team, either via informal one-to-one conversations, or training and workshop sessions. By documenting solutions in our knowledge base system, Cloud TSEs will increase the efficiency of our customers, other team members and departments throughout MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You must be willing and able to work weekends. This is a full-time position working Tuesday to Saturday, based in-office at our Melbourne or Sydney location.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What we’re looking for\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self taught, curious, and multi-faceted. You’ll need excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and be knowledgeable about a wide range of internet technologies. You should also have:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Solid fundamentals in Linux, and networking\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Knowledge of Amazon Web Services, or other major cloud providers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems across a variety of environments\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Patience, empathy, and a genuine desire to help others\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Bonus points\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fluency in a foreign language, especially Spanish, Japanese, or Mandarin\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Industry certifications such as RedHat Certified Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, or other related subjects\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fundamental understanding of MongoDB, or other databases (for example, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Postgres)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Previous application support experience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys.\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/channel/culture\u0026quot;\u0026gt; Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p style=\u0026quot;text-align: center;\u0026quot;\u0026gt;\u0026quot;MongoDB is an equal opportunities employer\u0026quot;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;","departments":[{"id":38814,"name":"Support","child_ids":[],"parent_id":6186}],"offices":[{"id":14625,"name":"Melbourne","location":"Melbourne, Victoria, Australia","child_ids":[],"parent_id":23659},{"id":3965,"name":"Sydney","location":"Sydney, New South Wales, Australia","child_ids":[],"parent_id":23659}]},{"absolute_url":"https://www.mongodb.com/careers/job/?gh_jid=5474667","data_compliance":[{"type":"gdpr","requires_consent":false,"requires_processing_consent":false,"requires_retention_consent":false,"retention_period":null}],"internal_job_id":2713233,"location":{"name":"Sydney"},"metadata":[{"id":22194060,"name":"Position ID","value":null,"value_type":"short_text"},{"id":24918,"name":"Department ID","value":"D11100-Support","value_type":"single_select"},{"id":22194061,"name":"Team","value":null,"value_type":"single_select"},{"id":4914027,"name":"Region","value":"APAC","value_type":"single_select"},{"id":4137836,"name":"Working Model Eligibility","value":["1-In Office"],"value_type":"multi_select"},{"id":4914029,"name":"Job Level","value":"IC - At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it much easier to manage and scale database deployments. These next-generation systems are a growing list but currently include products such as Atlas (\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;http://www.cloud.mongodb.com/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;www.cloud.mongodb.com\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;), Cloud Manager and Compass.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their outstanding problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are specialists in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, our management suite, and services such as Cloud Manager (the online product we developed for customers for automation, backup, monitoring, and analysis of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to achieve exceptional results for our customers.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are currently operating a hybrid working model and at this time, are ideally looking to speak with candidates who are available in Sydney or Melbourne. The standard work week post ramping will be Tuesday to Saturday, every week.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on standard methodologies in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services puts a strong focus on engineers enabling their peers to be successful by sharing newly gained technical knowledge with the team, either via informal one-to-one conversations, or training and workshop sessions. By documenting solutions in our knowledge platform, TSEs will increase the efficiency of our customers, other team members and departments throughout MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should have 4+ years of proven experience, we consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-taught, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;The ideal candidate should have a mix of experience in most of the following areas:\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong diagnostics and troubleshooting experience, with the ability to analyze issues holistically, from the application tier, to database to storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to read code, and basic coding/scripting ability in one or more languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, etc\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, etc.)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, RAID, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience supporting complex mission-critical product applications and database systems (RDMBS or non-relational)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should possess a genuine desire to help people, the ability to think on your feet and remain calm under pressure while solving problems in real-time. There’s a lot to learn, so the desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills is paramount. We work in a collaborative team environment, so a willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and good judgment to know when to seek help, is essential. We also aim to have diverse technical backgrounds and therefore different subject matter expertise is welcome.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;\u0026lt;em\u0026gt;You do not need to have prior experience with MongoDB. We can teach you that!\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/em\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with authentication systems such as LDAP, Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using any cloud services stack such as AWS, Azure or GCP\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with Kubernetes or other orchestration systems using vendor-specific Enterprise operators\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Success Measures\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 3 months, you’ll have gained a deep understanding of MongoDB and its ecosystem. You will complete New Hire Training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 6 months, you will be comfortable working frontline with our customers. You will also complete the MongoDB Certified DBA Associate exam\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 12 months, you will be a part of a technical experts group within MongoDB and will be helping your peer engineers in advance diagnostics. Also, you will be encouraged to handle technical escalations independently\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys.\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/channel/culture\u0026quot;\u0026gt; Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. Technical Service Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (database as a service), or Cloud Manager (which helps customers with automation, backup and monitoring of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork and a great sense of humour to help our customers to be successful with MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Barcelona for our hybrid working model.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex challenges - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on best practices in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - interfacing with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you design\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Performance tuning and benchmarking\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Extra bonus points if you have experience in one or more of Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, PHP, or Perl\u0026lt;br\u0026gt;\u0026lt;br\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;If you have an operations background, we At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Building on the rapid success and adoption of MongoDB, we are delivering applications and services that make it much easier to manage and scale database deployments.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Our Cloud Technical Services Engineers provide their exceptional analytical skills and customer service to ensure that MongoDB users are successful with our suite of MongoDB application-layer products. We’re looking for individuals who want to dig into the details of how “big data” and “web-scale” systems are successfully assembled and operated every day by organisations of every size and flavour.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Cloud Technical Services Engineers are a key part of our elite Technical Services organisation that supports MongoDB customers worldwide, with teams in locations including New York, Sydney, Gurugram, and Dublin. If you’re passionate about the opportunity to get comfortable working with the cloud every single day and be part of a team that works at the frontier of SaaS services and database systems, this is the role for you.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, focused on innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Responsibilities\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;As a Cloud Technical Services Engineer, you’ll be advising customers on strategies and documented practices for making best use of our cloud products. This will require you to translate technical concepts and patterns into generalist’s terms for our customers, helping them understand, install, and use those applications well. You’ll also troubleshoot technical problems with these products, and be an advocate for our users’ needs, collaborating with the MongoDB product management and development teams on their behalf.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services puts a strong focus on engineers enabling their peers to be successful by sharing newly gained technical knowledge with the team, either via informal one-to-one conversations, or training and workshop sessions. By documenting solutions in our knowledge base system, Cloud TSEs will increase the efficiency of our customers, other team members and departments throughout MongoDB.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You must be willing and able to work weekends. This is a full-time position working Tuesday to Saturday, based in-office at our Melbourne location.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What we’re looking for\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self taught, curious, and multi-faceted. You’ll need excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and be knowledgeable about a wide range of internet technologies. You should also have:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Solid fundamentals in Linux, and networking\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Knowledge of Amazon Web Services, or other major cloud providers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems across a variety of environments\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Patience, empathy, and a genuine desire to help others\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fluency in a foreign language, especially Spanish, Japanese, or Mandarin\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Industry certifications such as RedHat Certified Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, or other related subjects\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Fundamental understanding of MongoDB, or other databases (for example, ElasticSearch, MySQL, Postgres)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Previous application support experience\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their outstanding problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are specialists in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, our management suite, and services such as Cloud Manager (the online product we developed for customers for automation, backup, monitoring, and analysis of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork, and a great sense of humor to achieve exceptional results for our customers.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Why MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database, passionate about innovation and speed\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with exceptionally talented people around the globe\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Help establish a new team in APAC, influence the direction of the region and the future of MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between. You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on standard methodologies in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf. And you\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics. In addition, you will also be responsible for mentoring and ramping new team members and taking initiatives in building knowledge of new product lines within the MongoDB ecosystem.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You should have 5+ years of proven experience, we consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self-taught, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;It’s crucial for every candidate that they can check off all of these boxes:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Should have a good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, etc.)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience building and maintaining complex mission-critical production database systems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience analyzing issues holistically, from the application tier through the database, down to the storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Genuine desire to help people\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure, and solve problems in real-time\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be able to read code, and basic coding/scripting ability in one or more languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, etc\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Collaboration: willingness and ability to get help from team members when required, and the good judgment to know when to seek help\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Bonus Points\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience managing large scale databases (e.g. RDBMS, NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with authentication systems such as LDAP, Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using any cloud services stack such as AWS, Azure or understanding of MongoDB and its ecosystem. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Services Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (database as a service), or Cloud Manager (which helps customers with automation, backup and monitoring of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork and a great sense of humor to achieve exceptional results for our customers.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Austin or New York City for our hybrid working model, 3 days a week onsite.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers and partners encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers and partners, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on standard methodologies in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; and partners’ needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics. Externally, you will work with many of MongoDB\u0026#39;s top ISV partners and ensure excellence for our joint customers.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;In addition, you will also be responsible for mentoring and ramping new team members and taking initiatives in building knowledge of new product lines within the MongoDB ecosystem.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;What you need\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We consider all candidates with an eye for those who are self taught, insatiably curious, and multi-faceted.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;It’s important for candidates to check off these boxes:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience managing large scale databases (e.g. RDBMS, NoSQL)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters, and troubleshooting\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Should have a good understanding of Networking concepts and protocols (DNS, TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, etc.)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Storage engineering experience, including NAS, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing, and caching\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience building and maintaining complex mission-critical production database systems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Be able to read code, and basic coding/scripting ability in one or more languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C, C++, C#, Javascript, node.js, Go, etc.\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience working with APIs and other application integration technologies.\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability, and scalability\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience analyzing issues holistically, from the application tier through the database, down to the storage\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Genuine desire to help people\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Ability to think on your feet, remain calm under pressure, and solve problems in real-time\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Desire and ability to rapidly learn a wide variety of new technical skills\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively amongst cross functional teams (partner, sales, support, customer success, etc)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Willingness and clarity of thoughts to be able to work in ambiguous multi-party situations where motivations and incentives are sometimes misaligned\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;General understanding of partner ecosystems\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Bonus\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt; \u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Points\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience in one or more programming languages developing applications using a NoSQL or SQL database\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Strong understanding of authentication systems such as LDAP, Kerberos, AD\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using or managing MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using distributed version control systems, and in particular git\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience using any cloud services stack such as AWS, Azure or GCP\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience with Kubernetes or other orchestration systems using vendor-specific Enterprise operators\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experience in working software product teams, and familiarity with product release processes from planning to release\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Experience with one or more 3rd party partner technologies and software in the areas of security and fraud, big data analytics and AI, healthcare, content management, IoT, database performance monitoring and management; financial services, healthcare services, telco etc.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Success Measures\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 3 months, you’ll have gained a deep understanding of MongoDB and its partner ecosystem. You will complete New Hire Training\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;In 6 months, you will be comfortable working frontline with our customers and partners. At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB Technical Services Engineers use their exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Technical Service Engineers are experts in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, cloud and infrastructure. This also includes services such as Atlas (database as a service), or Cloud Manager (which helps customers with automation, backup and monitoring of their MongoDB systems). Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork and a great sense of humour to achieve exceptional results for our customers.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We are looking to speak to candidates who are based in Dublin for our hybrid working model.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt;Cool things you’ll do\u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers and partners encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it\u0026#39;s our job to help these people.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be working alongside our largest customers and partners, solving their complex issues - resolving questions on architecture, performance, recovery, security, and everything in between.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll be an expert resource on standard methodologies in running MongoDB at scale, whatever that scale may be. You\u0026#39;ll be an advocate for customers\u0026#39; and partners’ needs - working with our product management and development teams on their behalf.\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;You\u0026#39;ll contribute to internal projects, including software development of support tools for performance, benchmarking, and diagnostics. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The MongoDB Documentation team is a diverse and highly technical group of engineers who develop and maintain the documentation for the MongoDB product family. Our mission is to help developers and administrators successfully use MongoDB products by providing outstanding documentation. The MongoDB Documentation team is tightly integrated with the Product and Engineering organizations and works alongside the teams responsible for each product.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;The Cloud documentation team is responsible for the following industry-leading MongoDB products and services:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.atlas.mongodb.com/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Atlas\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, the cloud-hosted, fully managed database as a service\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.atlas.mongodb.com/atlas-search/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Atlas Search\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt; and \u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-vector-search/vector-search-overview/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;Vector Search\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, embedded relevance-based and semantic search in MongoDB Atlas\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-sp/overview/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Atlas Stream Processing\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, process streams of complex data using the same data model and Query API used in Atlas databases\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/data-federation/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Atlas Data Federation\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, natively query, transform, and move data across source clusters and formats\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.mongodb.com/datalake/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Atlas Data Lake\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, an analytic storage service optimized for flat or nested data with low latency query performance\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.cloudmanager.mongodb.com/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Cloud Manager\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, the cloud-hosted database management service\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.opsmanager.mongodb.com/current/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Ops Manager\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, the on-premises database management service\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.mongodb.com/kubernetes-operator/master/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Kubernetes Operator\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, orchestrate MongoDB pods and their Cloud or Ops Manager configuration\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.mongodb.com/bi-connector/current/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB BI Connector\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, the SQL proxy for MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://docs.mongodb.com/charts/saas/\u0026quot;\u0026gt;MongoDB Charts\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, create visualizations for data in MongoDB\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;We take a hands-on approach to learning complex technical topics and building engineer-focused content on:\u0026amp;nbsp;\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Distributed systems in the cloud\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Relevance-based and semantic search\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Backup and restoration\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Creating and modifying database deployments\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Enterprise-grade security\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Performance\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Managing high availability and scalability in MongoDB clusters\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Code samples in several popular languages (Node.js, Python, Java, Go)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Your work will empower a global community of millions of engineers ranging from experienced MongoDB users to those new to MongoDB.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Candidate Profile\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Candidates must have 5+ years of combined experience across any of the following roles: technical writer, developer advocate, software engineer, and/or product management. Beyond industry experience, we are looking for someone who is:\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experienced helping engineers understand product concepts and perform procedures both programmatically and through GUIs\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;A critical reader and an excellent writer\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experienced deploying and troubleshooting instances of software management tools locally and on one or more of the major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure)\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Comfortable reading application code to understand product functionality, especially code written in Java, JavaScript, or Go\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Experienced testing and troubleshooting new product software\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Experience with Apache Lucene or full-text search is a plus.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Position Expectations\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Work with technical and non-technical teams to meet the documentation needs of our readers\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Research product features and validate with diligent testing\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Produce technically accurate documentation that users value\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;Contribute feedback to the team\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Success Measures\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;You are comfortable with our toolchain and writing style\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;You can complete small to medium complexity writing assignments\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;li\u0026gt;You are comfortable reaching out to SMEs and participating in intra- and inter-team discussions\u0026lt;/li\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;/ul\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;h3\u0026gt;Contract Details\u0026lt;/h3\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;Anticipated End date:\u0026lt;strong\u0026gt; \u0026lt;/strong\u0026gt;1/31/2024\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;This role well be based remotely in the US.\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys.\u0026lt;a href=\u0026quot;https://www.mongodb.com/blog/channel/culture\u0026quot;\u0026gt; Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB\u0026lt;/a\u0026gt;, and help us make an impact on the world!\u0026lt;/p\u0026gt;\n\u0026lt;p\u0026gt;MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process.
